radiographic_examinations.findings: Appendix is dilated measuring up to 1.5 cm with wall thickening, hyperemia, and surrounding fat stranding consistent with acute appendicitis. There is a small outpouching from the appendiceal tip which may represent a contained micro-perforation. Trace fluid surrounding the appendix, but no fluid collection. Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, kidneys, stomach, and small bowel loops demonstrate normal findings. Scattered ascending colon diverticula without evidence of diverticulitis. Prominent right lower quadrant lymph nodes, likely reactive.
